critique: The executive order appears to be a formal and procedural document outlining amendments to the Foreign Service Regulations. It primarily focuses on the assignment, duties, and responsibilities of attachés and consular officers. The language is legalistic and devoid of emotional cues. The order aims to establish clear guidelines and procedures for the functioning of the Foreign Service, rather than to evoke any specific emotions in the audience. Therefore, the initial scores for all emotions are set to low values.
